ul.li: Exposure to heat can cause illness and death. The most serious heat illness is heat stroke. Other heat illnesses include heat exhaustion, heat cramps, and heat rash. Precautions should be taken to avoid heat illness any time temperatures are high, and the job involves physical work.
If a task causes exposure to hot molten glass, the appropriate shaded eyewear must be worn to decrease exposure to infrared radiation.
Hot surfaces are present in areas where hot molten glass is being produced. Use caution and proper hand and body protection while working in areas where hot molten glass is being produced.
Review the Emergency Action Plan before performing work.
